title: Hydrochloric acid reacts with sodium hydroxide

content.question:
<math alttext="H C l, aqueous, plus, N a O H, aqueous, react to produce N a C l, aqueous, plus H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>â†’</mo><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
A student had two dilute, colorless solutions, <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, which were at the same temperature. The student combined the solutions, and the reaction represented above occurred. Which of the following results would be evidence that a chemical reaction took place?

choices.label: The temperature of the reaction mixture increases.
The total volume of the mixture is approximately equal to the sum of the initial volumes.

content.answer: The temperature of the reaction mixture increases.

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
